p: No significant repulsion response of SHBs was observed when SHB were presented a choice between Î³-terpinene and the control in a dual Y-tube olfactory assay ( X 2 = 3.452, df = 4, and p = 0.485) ( Figure 1). A similar pattern was observed when SHBs were exposed to a choice between p-cymene and the control ( X 2 = 0.680, df = 2, and p = 0.712) ( Figure 1). These results indicated that T. ammi essential oil was a repellent to the SHBs, only due to the presence of thymol in the essential oil.
